content.user_title: Build RAG Pipelines with Vector Search
content.value_statement: Users struggle to connect document repositories with AI models for accurate, context-aware responses. This skill provides a complete RAG pipeline including document ingestion, vector search with Qdrant, and personalized prompt generation for specialized knowledge bases.
actual_capabilities: Scan and process documents from a docs directory
Clean markdown files by removing frontmatter and imports
Chunk text into segments with configurable overlap
Store and search vectors in Qdrant collection
Create personalized prompts based on user background
limitations: Does not include the actual Python implementation files
Requires external Qdrant vector database setup
Requires Google Vertex AI or compatible embedding service
Does not handle real-time document updates automatically

output_examples.input: How do I implement document ingestion in the RAG pipeline?
output: The ingestion process scans the docs/ directory, cleans markdown files by removing frontmatter and imports, chunks text into 1000-character segments with 100-character overlap, generates embeddings using text-embedding-004, and upserts vectors to the Qdrant collection named 'physical_ai_book'

output_examples.input: What chunk size should I use for technical documentation?
output: Default chunk size is 1000 characters with 100-character overlap. Adjust based on document structure complexity and query types. Technical manuals with hierarchical headings may benefit from smaller chunks.

output_examples.input: How can I personalize responses based on user expertise?
output: The personalization module reads user background fields like software_background and hardware_background to construct tailored system instructions that adapt explanations to the user's technical level.

best_practices: Use consistent chunk sizes and overlap to ensure relevant context is captured
Clean documents thoroughly before embedding to remove noise and metadata
Test vector search quality with sample queries before deployment
anti_patterns: Using very large chunk sizes that include irrelevant context
Skipping document cleaning steps which can pollute embeddings
Ignoring similarity metrics when evaluating search quality

faq.question: What embedding models are supported?
faq.answer: The pipeline uses text-embedding-004 by default. Any model producing 768-dimensional vectors with cosine similarity is compatible.

faq.question: What is the recommended chunk size?
faq.answer: Default is 1000 characters with 100-character overlap. Adjust based on document structure and query complexity.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing systems?
faq.answer: The modular architecture allows replacing individual components. The ingestion script and vector search client can be imported as modules.

faq.question: Is my data safe during processing?
faq.answer: Documents are processed locally before embedding. Only vector representations are stored in Qdrant, not raw content.

faq.question: Why are my search results poor?
faq.answer: Check chunk size settings, document cleaning quality, and embedding model compatibility. Consider adding more overlap or re-chunking.

faq.question: How does this compare to other RAG tools?
faq.answer: This implementation provides full control over each pipeline stage. Unlike managed services, you control infrastructure and data flow.
